intro: Sisymbrium pulchellum, commonly known as the pretty shepherd's purse, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the Brassicaceae family, which includes mustard and cabbage plants. The plant is characterized by its distinctive triangular seed pods and small, white or pale yellow flowers. It typically grows in disturbed soils and is often found in fields and along roadsides. Sisymbrium pulchellum is an annual herb that thrives in temperate climates.
